title: Are there any fat K-pop idols? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not exactly. There are some kpop idols whose bodies or features don’t completely fit the ‘typical’ skinny kpop look, but they aren’t what you would normally call fat. In no particular order, here are some of them. IU. During debut, she was fat-shamed a lot, and during some performances, people in the audience threw objects at her and called her a pig; at the time, she was only 15. She is much thinner now. 2. Wendy of Red Velvet. It’s certain that some of the rude comments on her weight and appearance got to her. At one point, she was so skinny that her ribs showed through easily; most likely it was due to extreme dieting, either brought on by the management or of her own will.  3. Seunghee of CLC.  4. Kyla of PRISTIN. Allegedly, there was a point in time that fans of PRISTIN refused to cheer for her, calling her “ugly” and “fat”.  5. Hwasa of MAMAMOO.  6. Taeha of MOMOLAND.  7. Joy of Red Velvet. Though she has lost weight since debut, Red Velvet as a whole, in the beginning, was mocked a lot and fat-shamed by netizens.  8. Jihyo of TWICE.  9. Umji of GFRIEND. There was a time where she was covering her face with her hair on stage because some fans were calling her fat. Now, she has lost weight.  10. Seungkwan of SEVENTEEN. Now, he isn’t even close to fat; he only has naturally chubby cheeks. Once, a member of the PLEDIS management hit him in the head and told him to lose some weight. He just lowered his head and said “sorry”.  Of course, I haven’t included all of the idols that could fit into this list, so again, these are just a few of the idols who have been picked on for their body, or have appearances that are different from the kpop star “norm”. I think that currently, there has been a little bit more acceptance showing in Korea for different body types, but hate is still very rampant. Personally, I see nothing wrong with how they look at all! They all look great.

upvoters.user_id: Rose バイオレット Gacha

response.answer_text: I will say this one time and one time only. I don’t believe in the word fat. I say it jokingly about myself sometimes but It’s just a ugly and rude word to say. So instead of using the word Fat I will be using the word chubby or thicc. Shindong Super Junior.Shindong used to weight about 255.73 lbs. He was hated on but the hate soon turned to concern. Due to trying to many different diets he started to experience weight fluctuations. An irregular rising and falling in number or amount; a variation. He found it harder and harder to dance on stage. Inspired by Yoo Jae Hwan who had lost 70 lbs he tried the diet that they had done. He lost 37.4 lbs and now weighs 218 lbs.  IUIU was made of fun due to her weight a lot when she first debuted. I don’t know much about her but I do know her diet. Which in opinion that isn’t a healthy thing to be eating day after day when you are a singer and dancer.  It’s late here and i’m tired. I will do another one of these soon but just know that you are beautiful no matter what. If you wanna lose weight go ahead but don’t lose so much weight that you are beginning to be unhealthy. Stay beautiful guys.

Technically no, korea is a country with very high beauty standards and no company is going to let “fat” people debut. However there are some idols who’ve been fat shamed, here are some of them: 1.wendy (red velvet)  2. Kyla (pristin)  3. Jihyo (twice)  4. Hwasa (mamamoo)  5. Ailee (solo artist)  I personally think it’s absolutely ridiculous that these idols were fat shamed! I mean they might be a little curvy, but fat!? no! I think there should be more idols like this, instead of all those perfect bodies. Girls only seeing skinny girls with tiny waists will feel ugly and sad. When we convince them that curvy girls can also be beautiful, they will feel beautiful too. So just to sum it up, all idols are beautiful, no matter how fat or skinny they are.❤️

There are 2 types of fat Kpop Idols. The one’s who aren’t fat yet people want them to lose weight (a.k.a fat shaming) and the ones who are actually fat. However, to find an actual fat kpop idol is very rare, and I mean VERY: I only know of one k-idol who is actually fat, and his name is… SHINDONG from SUPER JUNIOR  Shindong has tried dieting, but he generally tends to yo-yo in weight. Yet he is one of the top dancers in SUJU, and is a funny and talented guy with a kind personality. I honestly find it ridiculous how k-idols have to fit a specific standard for their body and looks and if they are a TEENSY bit chubby, then they get bashed by knetz, causing the idols to go on diets that make them almost starve themselves. And if they are too skinny then the knetz bash the idols for looking like a skeleton. It’s really stupid, plz dont be one of those knetz. :)

Well technically speaking nobody should be called fat they aren't fat they are just big. Due to their training and career they have to be able to dance for a long period of time. But there are two that I consider to be husky or bigger boned. Those two both come from the group Super Junior. Shindong has been subject to a lot of different comments regarding his weight and I don't think that's right. Keep in mind that he is one of if not the best dancer in this group. He's able to dance and perform without any problem.  The other member being Kangin. He, I think would be considered big boned especially his face. He has lost quite a lot of weight since his debut with the group.  I must say that having idols that are bigger is important and shows that body image shouldn't matter, the talent is what matters. Some people can't help but be a bit chubby and big it's just in their genes. Just as long as your healthy and happy that's all that matters. Cheers, fighting!

At least among Kpop women their aren’t any heavy set idols, but I think there’s more leeway when it comes to the men of Kpop. For instance Shindong from Super Junior isn’t thin, still, he’s a great dancer and singer. SM Entertainment doesn’t seem to mind or are forcing him to lose weight, and that’s good. He’s a talented man and shouldn’t be shamed into fitting some arbitrary beauty standard. However, like in every other endeavor, the requirements are different for women than with men. It shouldn’t matter, the talent should speak for itself, but that isn’t the case in Kpop or American pop music either.

The thought of calling them fat is wrong. First of all Korean beauty standards are too sh*t they have to look beautiful, thin,….It is just too boring and too rescuing for their life. I can’t tell who is fat because they are all BEAUTIFUL.BUT who got fat-shamed? 1.Wendy, RED VELVET  The main vocalist hasn’t been judged by the vocals that she had but the weight that she had.Which caused her a lot of pain, insecurities, starving to keep up for today :  2.Umji,Gfriend  The maknae always get body shamed for too much weight even though she is TOO CUTE !! 3.CL,2NE1,SOLO ARTIST  The baddest rapper in Korea which gets body-shamed for “too much weight” on her body .Even though her raps are hell flow!

I can think of one. The boy band Super Junior has a member named Shindong who is a bigger guy. I was shocked to see him and kinda felt like maybe there was some hope for the wholly eurocentric and fatphobic K-Pop world, but nope. Shindong and some of his fellow Super Junior members all took part it fat-shaming women in a radio interview some years back. Shindong basically said it’s OK for him to be fat, but women can’t be. K-pop culture (and I’m guessing probably Korean culture in general) is problematic, but I digress. Yep, there’s at least one fat K-pop idol.

Well in my opinion there is only one kpop idol who is actually more on the chubby side but not like fat, but still, I don’t know all kpop idols so there could be a whole kpop group dedicated to fat kpop idols (in Japan there is one, called fallen angel). Well, the only overweight kpop idol in my opinion is Shindong from Super Junior. However he has lost weight over the years.  Shindong in 2005  Shindong in 2018 As you can see, he has lost weight over the years. But his bmi is 28.41, which is considered overweight. (his weight is 90kg and lenght is 178cm, according to kprofiles)

Idols aren’t usually fat cause of their hectic work schedules. Apart from working out they diet and have to practise dance routines which helps them maintain their weight. There are some who will be quite plump but eventually lose their fat. FOR EXAMPLE- Wendy of Red velvet POST-DEBUT  PRE-DEBUT WENDY  There are so many examples actually. WENDY is just one of them.

If you are more than 110 stone you can not be a k-pop idol. You cannot be more than 110 stone because no company accepts that. Some companies make k-pop trainees do a exercise class, and a lot of new trainees do get tried very fast. One trainee before had a blackout, for some reason. They also dance, so that helps them keep fit. They also have beauty standards. The answer is no they can't get fat. Unless the company allows you. Female k-pop trainees/ idols most likely not to be fat.

PSY, you must remember the Gangnam style guy! His weight is quite normal but he does not exactly fit the Korean ideal, yet was still admirably successful and is most likely the wealthiest k-pop star today. Although his fame was short, Gangnam style and his other popular song Gentlemen, were extremely successful together have over 4 billion views!

The only one I think is fat is Shin Dong from Super Junior. Many are called fat but that’s reserved for any girl weighing more than 50 kg. Except for Shin Dong most idols deemed fat are usually put on a strict diet. Should note that CL from FX got kind of fat when she went solo but she seems to have lost it. Aileen was deemed fat as was IU but both have slimmed down although Ailee is still curvy.

Not really and it’s sad because lots of idols were fat shamed when they were a perfectly healthy weight but when idols are dangerously thin people think of them as being the typical weight an idol should be. People consider this fat:  Which is horrible, they were probably never fat shamed being at a healthy weight. But all the hate can lead to an idol losing extreme amounts of weight and being dangerously thin:

Well, there used to be this one group named piggy dolls. The concept was supposed to say that it was okay to be a tad overweight, but the concept I think was not selling out too well. The manager wanted money. So, of course, he flipped the concept and made it into a skinny theme and how you had you had to be skinny to be liked. Turns out the company did not see the overweight concept was selling rather well. Anyhow, when they mixed to the skinny theme, they got so much hate. Like, the hate Jennie from blackpink got. That much hate. It was horrible for the group and company in itself, and they disbanded. In myself, I do think they should have not mixed it up, as their view on life on the before concept was just fine.

I think Chanyeol and Suho from EXO, Wonho from Monsta X, Matthew from Kard (the last two are gym-fanatics!) Also I’m not sure what you mean as thick hehe. But yeah, ShinDong from Super Junior has always been chubby! From the start till now! For the ladies the Queens Hwasa from Mamamoo and LE from Exid. I think Nancy from Momoland, Wendy from RedVelvet wasn’t the typical Kpop ItGirl at first but she has now lost a lot of weight! Male Idols: Rain has a really good built too!
I know of PSY, he’s not fat but he’s the ‘widest’ if that makes sense?
Yes. Super Junior Shindong (debuted in 2005) and Pristin Kyla (debuted in 2016 and currently in hiatus for health problems)

Not really. I can only think of Shindong, who many other answers mentioned so I won’t say any more. Also, CL has had a weight gain, but during her prime time as an idol (when 2NE1 was still together) she was mostly okay with her weight, only in more recent years has she gotten bigger. Most kpop idols, even ones some people consider “bigger”, as some people featured in other answers, aren’t fat.

A group called Piggy Dolls debuted in 2011 and their differentiator from other groups is that they’re all plus size. Eventually, they were pressured to lose weight. They didn’t last long. Personally, I found them to be one of the weaker groups that debuted that year in terms of concepts and song releases. They were only different because of their weight. That’s it. :/

The Piggy Dolls I think when they debuted~ They did lose weight after but I remember that time it made quite a buzz~  They’re not around anymore, don’t know what the members are up to~ Here’s my fave song from them:
Kyla from Pristin. Always get bullied by many K-netz because of her body. But she’s pretty!

I can’t really say fat I would say the term big and fluffy. Also only one person comes in mind an it’s Shindong from Super Junior. People say you have to be fit but look at Shindong he isn’t trying to lose weight or get abs he likes his pot belly and so do we his fans. He even says it himself as an introduction .
The group Piggy Dolls.
I think there is a group called big Angeles but I am not sure if it's a jpop or a kpop group because I dont really know much of the group.
QUEEN HWASA
Shindong(SUPERJUNIOR)
